discourse_list.title: The Schuppi & ElPro MakerDAO Delegate Happy Hour -- Featuring Raphael as Co-Host of Episode 5

content.content: “Gotta give us what we want, Gotta give us what we need. Our freedom of speech is freedom or death We got to fight the powers that be” –Carlton Douglas Ridenhour NO INVESTMENT ADVICE This Content is for entertainment and informational purposes only, you should not construe any such information or other material as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice. Nothing contained on the FlipFlopFlap YouTube Channel constitutes a solicitation, recommendation, endorsement, or offer by @ultraschuppi @ElProgreso @rspa Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC, Flipside Crypto or any third party service provider to buy or sell any cryptocurrencies, securities, or other financial instruments. Nothing in this YouTube Video constitutes professional and/or financial advice.  Let’s get to it! This episode was recorded a day earlier before the arrest of the 29-year-old open-source privacy-tool developer, Alexey Pertsev by the Dutch Fiscal Information and Investigation Services (FIOD). 01:00 some initial thoughts on the state of crypto, MakerDAO, and TC. 07:45 Special Invited Guest Marc Zeller @marczeller  of AAVE rugged us  08:15 Thoughts on the Risk of DAI continuing to be backed by USDC  image1108×896 61 KB  12:30 Beer Tastings!    Raphael: Unser Dorfbräu - 2Sam from Seeshaupt, Bavaria, Germany   Rating: 3.2    ElPro: Big Game Three Limited Edition - Peated Stout - Wreżel Brewery, Zarzecze, Poland  Rating: 3.6    16:15 In Germany you will see pre-teens walking on the street drinking Bier  17:50 Flipside Crypto Dashboard and querying tool for looking into the previous history of Tornado Cash Transaction Addresses  (check it out) 19:30 What Stablecoin was used the most via TC? Maybe @rspa can provide us an update on the number of wallet addresses that used DAI via TC? Here’s another dashboard (DUNE) showcasing ETH Addresses that move USDC to the PSM 26:30 Small chatter about our original intentions to discuss AAVE’s Stablecoin GHO 29:55 Thoughts on Poll: MIP9 Community Greenlight Poll - Pando (Pando Investment Grade Climate Assets) - and how Raphael’s buddy puts renewable energy to good use. 33:50 Kroll Bond Rating Agency and why MKR token owners and @Recognized-Delegates should start to support the Clean Money initiative. 38:00 Recycling PVC solar panels (its a current problem) “California went big on rooftop solar. Now that’s a problem for landfills”  --LA Times 41:00 SourceCred: Recommendations to @GovAlpha-Core-Unit  on how to solve the current issues of spamming the Maker Forum and reward SourceCred to those that are providing services for the advancement of MakerDAO.
content.GPT-summary: The post is a summary of the Schuppi & ElPro MakerDAO Delegate Happy Hour, featuring Raphael as co-host of Episode 5. The content includes initial thoughts on the state of crypto, MakerDAO, and TC, a special invited guest, beer tastings, and discussions on various topics such as stablecoins, renewable energy, and spamming the Maker Forum. The post also includes a request for an update on the number of wallet addresses that used DAI via TC.

content.content: Thanks @rspa for covering me during vacation - great job! Looking forward for next week

flipflopflapdelegate:  AAVE   Speaking of AAVE, I just saw this:  twitter.com    Watcher.Guru @WatcherGuru  JUST IN: Tron CEO Justin Sun says AAVE blocked his address after someone sent him 0.1 $ETH randomly from Tornado Cash.   10:32 AM - 13 Aug 2022           4.1K                550

content.content: @marczeller bro, you should have pump it when @rspa and I told you to rock it kek
Thanks for having me @flipflopflapdelegate and Schuppi, thanks for letting me sub. It was a blast!!
Lol the Bavarian lakes are great for a beer and cool water this time of the year

Hats off to you guys, you’re working even on weekends to provide us such a great content. Awesome episode as always.    The Schuppi and ElPro Delegate Happy Hour post-EthCC – Paris 2022, Episode 3    all from Holsten   if you like Weizen  - Weihenstephan  is a decent bavarian brewery, also Paulaner    Jever  is also a pretty good pick    @ultraschuppi You suggested me some beers in Episode 3 thread. I didn’t get the rest, but Today I enjoyed this video with Holsten

content.content: Hope you enjoyed it! I will bring Paulaner Weizen next week - already in the fridge
Holsten was superb. A wine shop owner is my friend. I have requested him to make all of these available for me. Hope I will also get Paulaner next week.
